question:
The Government has recently given its approval for implementation of the Jal Marg Vikas Project (JMVP) for capacity augmentation of navigation on National Waterway-1 (NW-1). In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The project is being implemented with the financial and technical support of the World Bank.
  2. The National Waterway-1 covers five states
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The World Bank has approved $375-mn loan for Indiaâ€™s first waterway project NW1. This project involves development of water transport fairway on a 1,360-km stretch of the Ganga River between Varanasi and Haldia. It will help in the construction of infrastructure needed to develop water transportation in the area. Also the project will finance the construction of six multi-modal terminals, 10 RORO jetties, ship-repair facilities as well as passenger jetties along the river. The project is being implemented with the help of financial as well as technical support from World Bank. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The NW-1 covers four states viz. Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal. The major districts covered are Varanasi, Ghazipur, Ballia, Buxar, Chhapra, Vaishali, Patna, Begusarai, Khagaria, Munger, Bhagalpur, Sahibganj, Musrhidabad, Pakur, Hoogly, and Kolkata.
